comment: The class assignments are relatively easy but there is a lot (don't wait). The Exams are the difficult part - it's not only lockdown but uses MonitorEDU where someone watches you take the exam, and the exams are not like the quizzes, you have to go to the practice Exams. Most of the actual teaching was done by the TA, as the class uses McGraw.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: All the material is thrown at you from the beginning, with no time to actually go over or learn any of it. The overboard proctoring system requires your phone camera, a computer webcam, and three additional programs to download.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Abernathy was good. I think he needs to make better use of Excel, especially with formulas and references to help understand the financial statement consolidation process, because at first, it's a bit daunting for most students. I thought the HW was fair and the quizzes were good practice. This class is ADVANCED, but good to take to prep for FAR.

Not as good as they say he is ngl. Only con he has really is that you don't know your grade most of semester. Homework was easy he would give us the answer to those and the great adventure. hated great adventure. every section the lowest grade would get dropped. went online last few weeks. would rec him

Honestly, I don't know if it was just this semester, but he was not that great a professor. Felt like he didn't know much when he would talk. I learned more from the homework, but I guess that's the point of the homework. If you can't learn that way, I recommend a different professor. Other than that, it wasn't a very difficult course. A LOT of EC.

Professor Abernathy is a great option for ACCT2101. Knows what he's talking about! Moved class to teams meetings like halfway through the semester. Tons of homework and a few projects but that's typical for ACCT2101. Tests weren't bad - same for every acct class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: This class is way overhyped for how difficult it is. I've gotten an A on every exam and never showed up to class once. He has recorded lectures and lets you use a note sheet on each exam. Also has a practice exam that is similar to the actual one.

This course is extremely difficult, and while attendance is not graded, if you miss class you will not succeed. I think this professor does a great job teaching while class is in session. The reason i rated a 3 instead of a 5 is because there was multiple times this semester i requested extra help and was blown of or canceled on.
Took him for summer and honestly his lectures are very interactive and easy to follow considering how hard accounting is. Would take him again. Everything is on connect.

If I could take every class at KSU with Abernathy, I would. He is the best professor here and very understanding when it comes to assignments. I had a lot going on, and he offered me an extension on a few of my smaller assignments to not affect my grade. The material is a lot, but he encouraged me to do better than I ever thought I would in ACCT.

The best accounting professor. 60% of your grade comes from four equally weighted tests, and the practice tests in Connect are very similar to the real thing. 33% comes from four weekly homework assignments in Connect, the lowest of each category is dropped. 7% from an Excel project. Often does some of the homework in class.
Incredible professor, I will be taking him for my upper level accounting classes as well.

is a good teacher and cares about his students. His lectures were great and related to the test. I advise you to go to class he goes through the connect smartbook, and CW. Uses proctorio on tests so study. Also, a big project that is very difficult and worth a lot of your grade but offers extra credit. It was a heavy workload, but it was due able.

Dr. Abernathy is a great professor. This summer was my fourth time attempting accounting 2101 (withdrew twice, failed once), but this summer with Dr. Abernathy I literally got a 98% in the class. The material was explained extremely well. The class moved quickly because it was a summer class and yet I always felt like I understood what was going on

This guy is hilarious and will make sure that you understand every criteria! He will call you out if you are wrong in a jokingly manner but he will make sure to explain it better to make sure you understand. Great professor! I recommend taking him!
TAKE DR.ABERNATHY! You can't ask for a better teacher coming from a student who just wants to skate by you have to learn this stuff but he makes it super easy
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Abernathy is a teacher who understands the struggle of being a working student. He will help you when required with your deadlines if you have outside stuff to do if you tell him with enough time and although he gives around 5 things to do per chapter, you'll be fine if you just pay enough attention to his class and do the homeworks.

John Abernathy is amazing. The class itself can be really hard if you don't prepare well, but he does an excellent job at explaining it in a digestible and interesting way. Do not skip class!!! Lots of people did, and low test scores reflected that. This isn't an easy class, but take good notes and you'll do fine. He wants you to succeed.

COMPLETLY CHANGED COURSE. This course does not go off the old curriculum it is entirely changed! Old reviews no longer pertain to how this is taught! The tests are extremely hard with no extra credit offered. Find another professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Abernathy is a great professor. I took him for advanced financial accounting which is a difficult course but he does very well at teaching it. It was 3 exams (not including the final) & homework/ quizzes in connect. Exams are hard but you can easily be prepared if you attend his lectures & practice the material on connect. Highly recommend him.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: Professor Abernathy is amazing! I took his course online over the summer, so the workload was heavy. The good news is you have a good bit of wiggle room in case you mess up on an assignment or two. Professor Abernathy gives plenty of bonus assignments to help your grade and practice assignments that will prepare you for tests and quizzes.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor is nice and responds quickly! But get ready to record yourself almost every week because BOTH quizzes and exams are proctored. Utilize the practice/bonus assignments. Grade system is kinda confusing. Class itself isnt too hard but Im not a study person and I HAD to study for this class. Dont expect to slide by easily. Put in the work!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT--Get ready to read

comment: Get ready to pay over $100 for connect. All of the classwork and exams are on there. Lots of busy work to do that somewhat preps you for the exams/quizzes. Watch the lectures that he does provide, it somewhat helps too. Quizzes/Exams are all on Proctorio (a monitored browser). If you take him, good luck. Don't let his overall rating fool you.
Professor Abernathy is one of the best accounting professors at KSU. Really knows his stuff and can answer why things are the way they are. Lectures are interesting and you will learn a lot.

Professor Abernathy, is no doubt, the best accounting professor at Kennesaw State! You can tell he cares about his students and their success because he will not move on to the next topic until everyone understands. He has an amazing sense of humor and *might* actually convince you to become an accounting major! Take his class!

Professor Abernathy is a great professor to take. I was having a hard time with this class with it being online due to covid and he was willing to put in extra time to work with me on zoom to make sure I was understanding the stuff. He truly cares about his students and wants you to succeed. Take him if you can.

Professor Abernathy is the best accounting prof at Kennesaw. I am an accounting major, and I had him for 2100. He teaches everything very clear, and his lectures were informative. He explains every concept and does practice problems. 2 tests, a final, and homework. Tests are straight forward, and final is cumulative.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: So gladI had professor Abernathy as my first accounting professor. He makes the material fun and easy to understand. Attendance isn't mandatory, but going to class will help you out in the long run because he explains the material very well and makes everything so much easier to understand.

This class is so tough, I couldn't miss a class no matter what! Abernathy can be funny and very informative. Attendance and homework is not mandatory, but it helps. You can receive extra credit from homework that's due like every other week. No Connect! There's 3 exams and the final is optional. To help pass, study notes and problems from class.
He is straight forward with what is required and you get 3 chances to submit work with highest grade counted (homework & quizzes). Its an easy A if you do the work.
very easy

He was great! This class and professor is what made me change my major to accounting. He is funny but also knows how to get to the point and teach with clarity. HW and quizzes are done online. Tests are multiple choice. Don't expect much extra credit.
Dr. Abernathy is awesome. I seriously don't have enough room here to say all the good things about him he deserves. Take him for accounting if at all possible.
Abernathy is a good teacher to take with an extremely fair grading system. Homework and quizzes are 50% of the class and the other 3 exams which are hard but slightly curved

Amazing professor! Makes the material very understandable especially if accounting isn't your thing. Just stay on top of assignments and you'll be off to a good start. And come to class. His lectures are engaging and will help you get a much better grasp of the material. Would definitely take again!!!
Professor Abernathy is a great professor  and I would take again.

Class was insanely easy, I ended up with almost a 100. He teaches really well and caters to those who don't enjoyunderstand accounting. The biggest challenge for this class that I heard was managing your timeremembering to do all the online assignments. My only criticism is that if you enjoy accounting like me, he doesn't go in much depth.

I can't say enough about Professor Abernathy, he was super helpful throughout the entire semester and really cares about his students. I'm awful in accounting, yet I worked hard and did all the graded assignments, homework, online quizzes, then 2 tests plus the final. As long as you do the work, you can definitely get an AB.  Highly recommend!

50% of your grade is online HW & 50% is tests. Do all the HW & u only need a 60 avg on the tests to get a B. However, the HW & class lectures do not prepare you for the tests. Everyone bombed Test 2 because it was TOUGH. NOT an easy A. I stopped going to class because it was no help. He's not terrible, but I'd try to get someone better & easier.

Cannot say enough about Dr. Abernathy's course. This professor knows his stuff and is so amazingly helpful if you show up to office hours. Really a great person who cares about you and your grade and loves his work. Attendance is helpful as the material for an intro class can be immense (if not your major) but you will be prepared for 2200! A++
Prof Abernathy is more than helpful. He is willing to explain everything to you to help you understand the material. However, the course is difficult. He does his best! Take him if you can!!

Great Professor! Very funny and down-to-earth personality. Makes class enjoyable. Took the course during the summer, yet he took the time to make sure you understood the material. The course material is pretty tough to begin with and requires a high level of understanding of accounting. Had 3 tests + cumulative final exam, drops lowest of the 4.

Great professor. He doesn't explain things too well but he gives you SO many chances to succeed. TAKE THEM! He's also very personable, not what you would expect from an accounting professor. You can pull a B out of this class.

Made Accounting enjoyable and it made class fun to be in i loved his class every day! Very helpful with the material and will make time to break it down for you. Wish he taught more upper level classes. He is not easy but makes it worth your while to critically think.

Wonderful teacher, makes class fun and enjoyable and very laid back. May require you to teach some of the concepts to yourself so you can understand better, therefore the book might be necessary for you. As long as you work hard, you'll get an easy A. Three tests and a small project.

Great Professor! KSU is lucky to have him. He is not easy by any means, but he is very willing to work with students and help in any way he can. Lectures are fun and entertaining. An A is not impossible.
Very helpful and patient with students not quite grasping the material. He wants you to get it and succeed.

Overall he is pretty great. He really cares about his students. It was his first year at KSU but has experience and is always there to help you out. Don't need book, but he assigns online homeworks. He's pretty funny and keeps class interesting. I'm not interested in accounting, and I think I'll make an A. Not a hard class, but good to attend.

He's a cool guy.  Makes jokes and really wants his class to understand.  If you study and ask questions you should do fine. He could however use more tools on Mcgraw hill connect like the chapter review questions.  He is slow to post test grades too. Overall a cool guy, but you HAVE TO study.
Straightforward class. He likes to joke around sometimes, class participation is appreciated. Relatively easy course.
Great teacher.  Not easy, but makes class fun.
